quest.name: Goodbye, ε̆│̆│Δ
journal: Omega has selected a new destination.

Omega expresses a desire to understand the seemingly illogical relationship between the Ilsabard contingent and the imperial population. In order to explore this inconsistency, it bids you teleport your group to Camp Broken Glass in Garlemald.

Your demanding mechanical companion insists that understanding its current issue will require questioning a representative of both the contingent and the Empire. With the implacable Omega and the shivering Alpha in tow, you set off to find some suitable interviewees.

※You must be accompanied by Omega and Alpha to complete this task. Speak with either of them at Camp Broken Glass should you become separated.

The men you question both remember you from an earlier visit, although with distinctly different emotions. Both, however, react to Omega's assessments in similarly unexpected fashion, providing the confused machine with a bounty of data to analyze. Once again, Omega asks that you relocate to a quiet place where it can process this new input.

※You must be accompanied by Omega and Alpha to complete this task. Speak with either of them at Camp Broken Glass should you become separated.

In the midst of discussing the interviewees' “inconsistent” responses and the unpredictability of mortal hearts, Omega exhibits a precipitous drop in energy supply─it would seem the cold weather affected its inner workings more than it anticipated. Omega commands you to apply friction to its outer frame, in an effort to raise its critically low core temperature.

Crisis averted, you confirm the direction of Omega's next destination: Victors' Spoils. The diminutive model clatters off with the feathery Alpha in close proximity, determined to learn more of burial customs and cognitive complications.

You arrive at Licinia's gravesite to find an imperial soldier paying his respects. Manius introduces himself, and Omega immediately subjects him to a barrage of probing questions. Although taken aback, Manius nevertheless does his best to respond, his honest answers leading Omega to the conclusion that it is not man who commands the strength of his heart, but rather emotion that controls the man...

Satisfied that no further revelations are forthcoming from Camp Broken Glass, Omega indicates its readiness to proceed to its third and final query. This last issue concerns the dearth of information regarding the ancients, and what their full impact on the Final Days might have been. Omega determines that the moon-dwelling Loporrits represent the best source of additional data, and your teleportation spell soon has you materializing inside Bestways Burrow.

In a stroke of good fortune, Omega's need for observational assistance is immediately filled by the appearance of an enthusiastic Growingway. They set off to examine the burrow's technology, and Omega returns from his Loporrit-guided tour with further questions about the ancients' near-ideal society. The ever-inquisitive machine now wishes to speak with “the watcher,” and agrees to your suggestion to ride Argos to the entity's tower.

Putting aside the potential ramifications of a fluff-based hierarchy, you manage to convince the stubborn Argos to bear you and your companions to the watcher's abode. The being in question patiently waits to be addressed, seemingly bemused by his unexpected visitors.

In response to Omega's query, the watcher suggests that a recounting of your experiences might paint a more vivid picture of the ancients and their deeds. The tales you share only serve to confound Omega further, however, as it struggles to reconcile its objective assessment of events with your highly personal perspective. The oft-beeping model nevertheless accepts the data which you and the watcher have provided, and states that its investigation is now completed. The time has come to make a return to Thaumazein.

Barely have Biggs and Wedge welcomed you back to Sharlayan when they explain that an urgent matter calls them away. You accompany them to their waiting airship, with Omega sharing the results of its investigations while you walk. Omega concludes that Sir's illogical actions strongly indicate the presence of a “heart,” which it has now defined as “a phenomenon which influences one's interpretation of reality.”

Upon arriving at the vessel, Biggs presses Omega to hold up its part of the bargain, and it finally provides you with a translation of the mystery transmission. It is a simple message, of hope and shared joy, the spiritual value of which appears lost on the ever-practical Omicron.

With the investigation over and its promised duty discharged, Omega returns to traveling the star with Alpha. Sharlayan, Radz–at–Han, Garlemald─the wide world and its many peoples await. There are questions yet to be answered, and the road ahead is long...
objectives: Speak with Omega and have it accompany you.
Speak with a contingent member while accompanied by Omega and Alpha.
Speak with an imperial citizen while accompanied by Omega and Alpha.
Accompany Omega to the designated location and then speak with it.
Rub some warmth back into Omega's frame.
Speak with Omega at Victors' Spoils.
Speak with Omega at the entrance to Bestways Burrow.

dialogue.name: ALPHA
dialogue.text: Kweh, kwe-kwe kweh!

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Our next destination will be Camp Broken Glass.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: I desire elaboration on the dealings between the Ilsabard contingent and the citizens of Garlemald.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: The report described the contingent's purpose as the salvation of the local populace. Furthermore, both factions faced a common enemy in the Telophoroi. Why did they not immediately combine forces to their mutual benefit?

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: This inconsistency requires closer examination. Forename, initiate teleportation.

dialogue.name: ALPHA
dialogue.text: Kweh-k-k-k-k-k-kweeeh...

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Teleportation successful. Evaluating immediate environs. A cold-weather region by Etheirys standards, but significantly less extreme than a star with ice planet classification.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: This body should not be unduly impeded. In contrast to Alpha and his uncontrollable shivering, my frame appears highly resistant to low temperatures.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Retrieving data. Records indicate that remnants of the contingent force and a number of imperial citizens yet inhabit this location.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: We must speak with representatives from both factions, and explore their respective attitudes. <blip> Proceed.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Omega and Alpha are now accompanying you. Keep them at your side in order to proceed with quest objectives.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You can leave your quest companions behind by entering a different area, or by speaking with them and selecting the option to part ways.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: If you wish to have your companions join you again, return and speak with them at the original location.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Talk.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Part ways.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Nothing.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Please approach a contingent member and an imperial citizen. I require input from both perspectives.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: I recommend you move at a brisk pace. The exertion will raise your body temperature, preventing you and Alpha from freezing to death.

dialogue.name: ALPHA
dialogue.text: Kw...kwe...kwe-choo!

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: Are you sure you wish to part ways with your companions?

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: <blip> Has your organic body reached its limit for cold exposure? Restore your temperature equilibrium, then find us again at the center of the camp.

dialogue.name: ALPHA
dialogue.text: Kwe-kweh...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Alpha races off towards the middle of Camp Broken Glass, breath steaming in the freezing air.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: <blip> You are functional again? Then let us resume our objective.

dialogue.name: ALPHA
dialogue.text: Kweh-k-k-k-k-k-kweh!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Omega and Alpha have yet to arrive. Be sure they are at your side before attempting to continue.

dialogue.name: HUNGRYGARLEAN
dialogue.text: A shadow from the past...?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You should have Omega and Alpha accompanying you before initiating conversation.

dialogue.name: HUNGRYGARLEAN
dialogue.text: A shadow from the past...? Yes, I know you from Victors' Spoils!

dialogue.name: HUNGRYGARLEAN
dialogue.text: Have you come to laugh at me!? A wretch who chose to lose Licinia and her sister rather than accept your help...? The fool who ended up reliant upon your charity nonetheless...?

dialogue.name: HUNGRYGARLEAN
dialogue.text: Well, perhaps I deserve your derision. My compatriots surely scorn my failed conviction.

dialogue.name: HUNGRYGARLEAN
dialogue.text: I have shamed my people, and brought dishonor upon my nation. I am no better than a kept beast, my pride sold for a bowl of feed...

dialogue.name: HUNGRYGARLEAN
dialogue.text: But my soul, nay, that you shall not have! I've refused your honeyed offers of a new home! This land is where I belong, and this is where I shall remain!

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: <blip> You demonstrate opposition to the contingent's overtures.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: On what basis do you refuse this cooperation? The data suggests the local populace is struggling to produce the bare minimum of sustenance.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Have you some secret strategy for survival? Or do your orders compel you to accept your present misfortune?

dialogue.name: HUNGRYGARLEAN
dialogue.text: Wha─? Must I be mocked by a magitek toy now!?

dialogue.name: HUNGRYGARLEAN
dialogue.text: No, I have no secret strategy! No binding orders! I but comport myself as any true Garlean patriot would! Uncompromising...unbending...

dialogue.name: HUNGRYGARLEAN
dialogue.text: ...Blast it all.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Once again, this input is...unanticipated. Let us move aside and process what we have heard.

dialogue.name: HUNGRYGARLEAN
dialogue.text: There is naught for me here! I know this! But if I surrender my homeland, then what was it all for...?

dialogue.name: ALAMHIGANDELEGATION
dialogue.text: Forename...?

dialogue.name: ALAMHIGANDELEGATION
dialogue.text: Forename...? Come to see how things are progressing, have you?

dialogue.name: ALAMHIGANDELEGATION
dialogue.text: I can't speak for the overall strategy, but communication with the locals has become a damn sight easier since Jullus and his soldiers stepped in to help.

dialogue.name: ALAMHIGANDELEGATION
dialogue.text: Oh, we still face our fair share of distrust, of course. Some folk even think we're enslaving minds with our “foreign magicks.” Hmph. We have Anima to thank for putting that idea in their heads.

dialogue.name: ALAMHIGANDELEGATION
dialogue.text: But all things considered, I'd say we're doing pretty well. Establishing an open dialogue was the first big step...

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Query. You consider this level of progress...acceptable?

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: The reality of your efforts falls far short of the ideal. If your aim is to provide efficient succor to the local populace, then absorbing their numbers into your command structure would be the optimal path.

dialogue.name: ALAMHIGANDELEGATION
dialogue.text: Oh, I wouldn't want to go that far. We're not looking to take over their nation.

dialogue.name: ALAMHIGANDELEGATION
dialogue.text: If we're to do this the right way, we need to recognize and respect each other's way of life.

dialogue.name: ALAMHIGANDELEGATION
dialogue.text: So while it may not be the easiest solution, I agree with the contingent's slow-and-steady approach. I'm just happy we're saving lives.

dialogue.name: ALAMHIGANDELEGATION
dialogue.text: I'm Ala Mhigan, but I was also an imperial conscript until not so long ago. Though I was lucky enough to have a decent commanding officer, many Garleans treated “provincials” like we were less than people.

dialogue.name: ALAMHIGANDELEGATION
dialogue.text: On the other hand, natives of Ala Mhigo didn't think much of us, either. I guess that's my roundabout way of saying I'm surprised this contingent was even formed in the first place. I feel fortunate to be a part of it.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: I require time and distance to process this data. Scanning for suitable locations...

dialogue.name: ALPHA
dialogue.text: Kweh...? Kwe-kweh, kweeeh?

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: <bloop> Alpha is absent.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Omega seems reluctant to continue without Alpha present. Be sure to have the chocobo with you.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Accessing and analyzing recorded data... Integration complete.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: I have evaluated this most recent input, and made comparisons to our discoveries in Radz–at–Han.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Consistent only in their inconsistency, the responses from both contingent member and imperial citizen were highly irrational. Conversely, any Omicron considering their predicaments would have echoed my assessment exactly.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: The divergence from self-evident logic is key...

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Hypothesis. The illogical relationship between would-be saviors and suffering populace is another result of the unpredictable nature of mortal hearts.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: <blip> Any property or ability has inherent advantages and disadvantages.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Yet never have I encountered such a unique detriment. It appears that those who share your metaphysical capabilities are prone to complicating simple cognitive processes.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: An undesirable quality. I will, however, persist in furthering my understanding of the subject.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Query. Prior to formulating our next step, I wish to know: who is this “Licinia” the imperial mentioned?

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Acknowledged. To summarize, insufficient data on foreign culture resulted in inadvisable and ultimately fatal action.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: I witnessed such self-destructive behavior during the course of our planetary conquests. Overwhelmed enemy forces would voluntarily withdraw into perilous regions, leading to a succession of inevitable losses.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: ...Tangential data request. I wish to learn about burial customs. The practice has ever seemed nonsensical, but new data suggests it arises from the same source as your cognitive complications.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Take me to this Licinia's burial site. It may aid me in understand...stand... <bloop> <bloooooop>

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Energy delivery systems compromised... Core temperature critically low...

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: <bleep> Warning! Immediate heating required. Request. Apply friction to outer frame...

dialogue.name: ALPHA
dialogue.text: Kweeeh!? Kweh, kwe-kwe-kweh!

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: <bloop> <blip> Temperature nominal. Energy levels stabilizing...

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: The creators of this model must have experienced impaired cognitive reasoning during the design process.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Upon our return, I will request additional climate shielding, as well as an accurate temperature sensor array. This will not affect my combat capabilities, but should improve my basic survival rate.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Reconfirming sub-destination. In which direction will we find Victors' Spoils?

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: <blip> Acknowledged.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Alpha, you are to remain in close proximity. Close enough to envelop me in your feathers. You are permitted to carry me on your back, if you so choose.

dialogue.name: ALPHA
dialogue.text: Kweh, kwe-kweh...?

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: <blip> A deceptively deep snowdrift almost defeated me, but we have successfully arrived at the location you indicated.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: <blip> Caution advised.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: An unknown individual appears to be investigating the object of my interest.

dialogue.name: COLLEAGUESOLDIER
dialogue.text: (-Ist Legion Soldier-)Hm...? You're Eorzea's champion, aren't you? Forename Surname.

dialogue.name: COLLEAGUESOLDIER
dialogue.text: (-Ist Legion Soldier-)Oh, I never introduced myself, did I...?

dialogue.name: COLLEAGUESOLDIER
dialogue.text: I am Manius, soldier of the Ist Legion and comrade of Jullus.

dialogue.name: COLLEAGUESOLDIER
dialogue.text: Perhaps you remember me from Tertium? We spoke about collecting ceruleum, and again later on, after Lord Quintus had...passed.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Manius. Explanation requested. What is the reason for your presence here?

dialogue.name: COLLEAGUESOLDIER
dialogue.text: That must be the tiniest magitek weapon I─ Ah, no, it's just an oddly shaped communicator, isn't it?

dialogue.name: COLLEAGUESOLDIER
dialogue.text: In any case, I have nothing worthy to report. I heard that the sisters who used to live in my sector were buried here, so I thought I'd come and pay my respects.

dialogue.name: COLLEAGUESOLDIER
dialogue.text: Alphinaud and Alisaie told me the story─complete with profuse apologies─though they were adamant that no amount of remorse could erase the tragedy of what came to pass.

dialogue.name: COLLEAGUESOLDIER
dialogue.text: Not that my fellow soldiers and I are in any place to judge. We were manipulated─fooled into starting an insurrection which led to countless deaths among our own countrymen.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Objection. The casualties incurred through your infighting are distinct from those caused by the Ilsabard contingent.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: To restate, you are justified in seeking restitution from the contingent for causing the deaths of Licinia and her sister. Retaliation for damages sustained is also a logical progression.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: I can deduce two reasons why you do not initiate hostilities with Forename and herhis allies.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: One. You judge your remaining forces too weakened to contend effectively with the contingent.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Two. Your...emotions...are complicating the issue.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Tell me. Which of these is correct?

dialogue.name: COLLEAGUESOLDIER
dialogue.text: Well, when you lay it out like that...

dialogue.name: COLLEAGUESOLDIER
dialogue.text: Ahem. I'm afraid my answer isn't like to win me any medals, so would you mind keeping this to yourselves?

dialogue.name: COLLEAGUESOLDIER
dialogue.text: There's the unspoken thought that we're outmatched on the battlefield, certainly. But the real reason I'm not demanding restitution has little to do with weighing the odds.

dialogue.name: COLLEAGUESOLDIER
dialogue.text: The simple truth is I'm so caught up with simple survival that I've no strength to spare for past grievances.

dialogue.name: COLLEAGUESOLDIER
dialogue.text: The same goes for avenging any comrades we've lost, be that my brothers-in-arms or Lord Quintus himself.

dialogue.name: COLLEAGUESOLDIER
dialogue.text: ...Although it seems everyone has an opinion about the manner of his passing.

dialogue.name: COLLEAGUESOLDIER
dialogue.text: Some say he should've fought until the end. That he abandoned us to the enemy.

dialogue.name: COLLEAGUESOLDIER
dialogue.text: Others praise him for taking the full burden of responsibility, and freeing us to walk our own path.

dialogue.name: COLLEAGUESOLDIER
dialogue.text: I don't know who's right and who's wrong, but I'm inclined to side with the latter. He gave us the choice of freedom, and that's the choice I made.

dialogue.name: COLLEAGUESOLDIER
dialogue.text: I could cry and rant and rage, but what would be the point? I'll save my energy for worrying about my next meal, my next task.

dialogue.name: COLLEAGUESOLDIER
dialogue.text: I need to focus on the ones left behind─on making some kind of life for my comrades and me.

dialogue.name: COLLEAGUESOLDIER
dialogue.text: And if I need to lean on the contingent to do that, then that's what I'll do. Even if their aid comes at a price, I'm willing to pay it.

dialogue.name: COLLEAGUESOLDIER
dialogue.text: Even amongst your own, there are times when cooperation demands compromise. What matter that they're outsiders?

dialogue.name: COLLEAGUESOLDIER
dialogue.text: Besides, I think I could grow to like Alphinaud and Alisaie. They've reached out to us with kindness and compassion from the very beginning.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Summation. Your desire to survive, even should it mean allying with the contingent, was a feeling you already harbored.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: That your side had committed worse atrocities was the logic you invented later to justify your reasoning.

dialogue.name: COLLEAGUESOLDIER
dialogue.text: Blunt but accurate, I suppose. The heart is honest about what it wants, even if the mind takes a while to reconcile the decision.

dialogue.name: COLLEAGUESOLDIER
dialogue.text: Well, this has been oddly cathartic, but I must return to my duties. There are wild beasts to cull, watch fires to light, supplies to transport... Even without an Emperor, there's no rest for an imperial.

dialogue.name: COLLEAGUESOLDIER
dialogue.text: Be well and stay safe.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: <blip> Upon review of recent input, I have arrived at an unexpected conclusion.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: I have been formulating my assessments on the premise that it was man who commanded the strength of his heart...but the data suggests the opposite is true.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: The surge of spirit, of feelings, of emotions can entangle your thoughts to such a degree that even control over your own behavior is compromised. It seems a most counterproductive specification.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: This also explains why my interactions with mortal subjects have produced more confusion than clarification. It presents a formidable barrier to understanding...

dialogue.name: ALPHA
dialogue.text: Kweh... Kweh, kwe-kweh...

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: <blip> My earlier hypothesis has been borne out. The suboptimal operation being conducted here is the result of emotionally compromised reasoning.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: I am ready to progress to my third and final query.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: I would learn more about those referred to as “ancients.” It is clear that this group was a crucial factor of the Final Days, but the information contained in the report was insufficient to form an overview.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: The Loporrits are creations of the ancients, and are said to maintain repositories of their knowledge. By my calculations, the base of these moondwellers will provide the best source of additional data.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Teleport us to their “burrow,” Forename. Preferably before my battery freezes over...

dialogue.name: ALPHA
dialogue.text: Kweh! Kwe-kweh!

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: <blip> Your teleportation spell was successful. We appear to have arrived at the location described as “Bestways Burrow.”

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: An inspection of the technology in use here would give me detailed insight into the ancients and their civilization.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: This body, however, lacks my previous frame's advanced observational functionality. I will require external assistance...

dialogue.name: GROWINGWAY
dialogue.text: Hm? No, it can't be...

dialogue.name: GROWINGWAY
dialogue.text: It is you! Oh, Forename, I've missed you so!

dialogue.name: GROWINGWAY
dialogue.text: <gasp> Wh-What's this you've brought with you?

dialogue.name: GROWINGWAY
dialogue.text: This soft, feathery vision!?

dialogue.name: GROWINGWAY
dialogue.text: We... We've been out-fluffed! Pack up the moon─it's all over!

dialogue.name: GROWINGWAY
dialogue.text: Why bother with burrow-building bunnies when you could walk around with this adorable avian engineer. Just bake me into a pie and be done with it!

dialogue.name: GROWINGWAY
dialogue.text: Inspect our inventions? Wait, so...you're not done with us?

dialogue.name: GROWINGWAY
dialogue.text: Hah, I wasn't truly worried, of course! And I certainly wasn't about to roll myself in dough and dive into Cookingway's new oven!

dialogue.name: GROWINGWAY
dialogue.text: Ahem. If a technical breakdown is what you need, then I am your Loporrit! As the resident atmospheric regulation expert, I can field any question or query you might care to pose!

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: <blip> Acceptable. I will employ this being to guide me around the facilities.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Your presence is not mandatory. Even locked within my current chassis, I am still an autonomous construct that has endured hundreds of your life cycles. I am capable of completing this simple objective alone.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Objective complete.

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Was the tour helpful?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: What happened to Growingway?

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Affirmative. I observed a representative cross section of the Loporrits' engineering capabilities.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: My guide required more time to confirm the answer to certain questions, but overall, we made efficient progress.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: After my fiftieth question, his responses began to suffer noticeable delays...

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: By that stage, we had viewed a representative cross section of Loporrit engineering, thus I deemed it unnecessary to retain his company.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Conclusion. Extrapolating from the fraction of technology on display, the full spectrum of the ancients' advancements was, at minimum, equivalent to a level four civilization.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: A fact which demands further investigation.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Despite establishing a near-ideal society, these beings nevertheless harbored a weakness which invited self-destruction. In studying them, I stand to gain a greater understanding of Sir's anomalous decision.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Growingway informed me that another type of ancient-made entity exists upon this satellite. The one they call “the watcher.”

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: I would speak to him.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: <blip> Then conserve your aether. We will ride this “Argos” to our destination, as you have suggested.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Argos is pointedly ignoring the existence of Omega and Alpha.

dialogue.name: ALPHA
dialogue.text: Kweh-kweh! Kweeeh kwe-kweh!

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: <bloop> Impedance detected. The creature identified as Argos refuses to acknowledge our presence.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Hypothesis. Upon our arrival, Growingway expressed concern that he had been “out-fluffed.” This suggests the existence of a fluff-based hierarchy.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: My station in such a system would be predictably low, but Argos is adamant in ignoring even Alpha. Its fluffiness level is impossible to gauge.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Argos turns to you with an impassive gaze. It seems you will need to intervene...

dialogue.name: Q4
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A4
dialogue.text: Just...think of them as luggage.

dialogue.name: A4
dialogue.text: You're the fluffiest of them all, dear Argos!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Argos gives an exasperated snort before motioning to his back. It seems you have permission to climb aboard!

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: <bloop> You have secured the creature's permission? Curious. You must have special standing in the fluffiness hierarchy.Curious. I suppose your body does exhibit a special kind of fluffiness.Curious. Is it your fluffy tail which provides such exemplary standing in the hierarchy?Your fluffiness rank must be significant indeed.Curious. Is it your fluffy ears which provide such exemplary standing in the hierarchy?

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: <bleep> I have allowed myself to become distracted. Let us continue on to the watcher at once.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: <blip> The watcher located. An estimate of this being's height explains the inconvenient scale of Bestways Burrow...

dialogue.name: ALPHA
dialogue.text: Kweeeh! Kwe-kweh kweeeh!

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: I was bemused by the arrival of these small visitors, but I see they are companions of yours.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: What a rare thing for my abode to be thus crowded... How may I be of service to you?

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Hello, watcher. My purpose here is to learn more about the ancients.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: I would know of their deeds, their philosophies─the very nature of their hearts. I would understand why the Final Days was visited upon my home star.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: A worthy endeavor. But there is another better suited to assisting you with that task.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: Perhaps you might favor us with a tale or two of the ancients you met during your travels, Forename?

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: My fragmented memories would be a pale substitute indeed for the clarity of your more recent experiences.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: Yes, I can envision every detail. Your meeting with Venat and Emet-Selch and Hythlodaeus. The sorrow and determination of Hermes.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: I am a creation of Hydaelyn, and as such, I believed the age of the ancients would fade and be forgotten...

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: Yet knowing that their memory lives so vividly within you...it brings me great joy. I pray you keep them close to your heart.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: At the time of your journey to the past, the one whose essence I embody would have been a scholar at Anyder. A shame. Had you reason to go there, perhaps you might have met.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: As a man of learning, he was firm friends with Venat. They spent long hours trading theories, or debating the laws of the universe.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: I “remember” joining her faction as the Final Days bore down upon us. Yet of the events surrounding that tragedy, I recall precious little.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: Hydaelyn wished for the people of your age to decide their own path, thus I suspect my recollection was limited by design.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: Yet even She could not cut away one persistent memory...

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: I feel most distinctly his sadness at what was to come to pass. That in becoming Hydaelyn's heart, Venat would forever stand apart from the people she so loved.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: If she were so resolved in her convictions, then he, too, would share her sleepless vigil over the future yet to unfold. Thus was the vow he made to Venat as her transformation took hold.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: His fervent wish must have reached her in some fashion... For though his life was drained away by the summoning, he was reborn with new form and new purpose when I awoke as the watcher of the moon.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: And you heard, Forename. You felt. You thought. And in seizing the future for yourselves have you brought full circle the saga which Venat began.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: What you accomplished was no divine miracle. It was but the beacon of hope, passed down from one generation to the next; a succession of wishes and prayers reshaping the star into the world we knew you deserved.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: You have our deepest gratitude. I thank you not only as myself, but as the man I once was, and on behalf of those who devoted themselves to Venat's vision.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: <bloop> <blooop>

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: I understand the facts of your story, Forename...

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: ...But not how you have chosen to process them. On what grounds do you speak of Venat with such fondness?

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: By sundering the world, she ultimately guided your kind to victory, yet in doing so caused irreparable damage to its individual members.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: The full scale of that act is beyond calculation. It is evident, however, that it resulted in a protracted period of suboptimal existence for Emet-Selch and his brethren.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Query. If the survival of your kind is the deciding factor in your evaluation, then should you not also admire Hermes and his decision to subject man to a trial? Forcing you to change or perish, as was the fate of countless civilizations before you.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: From my perspective, his determination was similar to that of the Omicrons' ancestors─those who first began trading flesh for machine, so that our people might stand against the onslaught of aggression from other races.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: It was an unprecedented attempt, accompanied by much failure and sacrifice. Their early experiments were crude. Primitive.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Had they not made those first advances, however, we would have remained vulnerable to our environment. The violence would have utterly consumed us.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: And what of Emet-Selch himself? Judging by your retelling, he was a benevolent ally saddled with tragic fate.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Yet I remember the years when my instruments fed me data from events across the entire star. During that time, I witnessed his Ascians engineer multiple instances of cataclysmic strife.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: These “calamities,” as you know them, were responsible for planet-wide destruction. A man whose endgame relied upon the extinction of all modern mortals must, by definition, be your worst enemy.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: I require an answer. As a being of heart and soul, how do you classify each of these pivotal figures?

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: From your perspective, which of them was most justified in their actions?

dialogue.name: Q5
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A5
dialogue.text: They were all justified in their own way.

dialogue.name: A5
dialogue.text: Venat.

dialogue.name: A5
dialogue.text: Hermes.

dialogue.name: A5
dialogue.text: Emet-Selch.

dialogue.name: A5
dialogue.text: None of them were.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: I...think I understand.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: You seek a definitive answer. Yet based on our experiences, Forename and I might develop very different opinions.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: In the same fashion, you are free to form your own thoughts on the matter. Do not be so swift to consider them without merit.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: I do not have my “own thoughts” on the matter. I assess each situation with the same logic pathways available to every Omicron.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Even if a thousand Omicrons were asked to analyze the same event, they would all return the same result...regardless of individual experience. There is no strength to be found in fractured reasoning.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Nonetheless, I find your input valuable. Recording data alongside interview results...

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: This concludes my investigation into the incomplete elements of the Final Days report.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: I will reanalyze the accumulated information, and examine the factors which led to Sir's incomprehensible decision.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: <blip> Let us return to Thaumazein.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: It was pleasant to hear your tales of Elpis. Should you ever need an audience familiar with the subject, I would be glad to listen to more of your recollections.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: Even with one's gaze fixed upon the future, we ofttimes find our thoughts drifting to the past. 'Tis a shame that Hydaelyn never chose to speak of it...

dialogue.name: WEDGE
dialogue.text: Forename! I wasn't sure you'd be back in time!

dialogue.name: SCIENTIST04586
dialogue.text: You had a fruitful trip, I hope? I am absolutely bursting to ask about your experiences with Omega, but I don't wish to be a pest.

dialogue.name: SCIENTIST04586
dialogue.text: I will swallow my questions for now, and maintain my academic decorum. Besides, it seems our engineering friends are in a hurry to leave...

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: <blip>

dialogue.name: ALPHA
dialogue.text: Kwe-kweh, kweeeh!

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: Ah, there you are─right at the last moment!

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: Your journey with Omega was properly educational, I hope?

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: We'd planned to ask you all about it and that mystery transmission besides, but I'm afraid something urgent has come up...

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: Seems one of our Ironworks associates has fouled up a job elsewhere, and Jessie needs Wedge and me to rush in and lend a hand.

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: There's an airship already waiting for us out in the harbor, in fact. Do you think you could escort us over there, and talk as we walk?

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: <blip> Acceptable. I am fully capable of speech during ambulation.

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: I figured you might be. Right, let's get a move on, then.

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: So...you've cleared up all those points of confusion, then?

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: ...I had mistakenly classified your intangible “heart” as an ability of some kind.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: An uncanny power that Omicrons could neither learn nor even measure.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Even now, its full nature yet eludes my comprehension.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Based upon our investigations, however, I have decided to alter my definition.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: “A phenomenon which influences one's interpretation of reality.”

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: That is as close to an answer as I have found.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Accordingly, Sir's actions upon meeting Meteion strongly indicate the presence of a “heart.”

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Sir did not follow routine logic, but formulated an independent assessment based upon the reality it perceived.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: It “felt” that the best recourse for the Omicrons was to cease their expansion, and terminate all functions...

dialogue.name: WEDGE
dialogue.text: Well, here's our ship!

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: Aye, we need to be going...but first, I'll hold you to your bargain, Omega.

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: It's time you told us what was in that transmission from the flight logs.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: <blip> Acknowledged. I will uphold the terms of our agreement.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: The recording salvaged from the Ragnarok was a simple one.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: The message is so basic, in fact, that the time spent listening to it may result in a net loss of value. Shall I continue?

dialogue.name: WEDGE
dialogue.text: Now you're just teasing! Tell us the message already!

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Acknowledged. Converting dialect coding to local language...

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: “To whomever receives this message out there in the vast reaches of the cosmos...

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: “To someone, I hope, who looks up at the stars with the same wistful gaze as mine...

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: “To you I say...forge ahead. May all our tomorrows be blessed with joy.”

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: This message had no designated recipient. It lacks purpose.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: The concept of “joy” is overly abstract. The vocal supplication to manifest said joy is unrealistic in its optimism.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Yet based upon their expressions, my assessment of the transmission's value conflicts with its apparent impact.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: And still, I fail to understand you, Sir. Your “heart” still confuses me.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Was termination of everything the correct course? How did you arrive at this conclusion?

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: It defies all my attempts at reasoning...

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: But I was designed to evolve. If I continue to learn, the probability that I eventually comprehend this phenomenon is greater than zero.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: So I will put the dilemma of your decision aside for now...

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: ...And continue my existence upon this distant star. As I dwell among these many life-forms, so will I continue to piece together the complete shape of their mortal hearts.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: I must document their progress...

dialogue.name: ALPHA
dialogue.text: Kwe-kweeeh!

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Your contribution to my education is appreciated, Forename. Indeed, I have amassed a satisfying quantity of valuable data.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Now that our negotiated business is complete, however, Alpha and I will return to traveling the world.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Drawing on recent experience, I am confident we can expand the radius of our ventures by a significant margin.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: We need not limit ourselves to Eorzea. I am now familiar with Sharlayan and Radz–at–Han, and would also like to revisit the freezing climes of Garlem─ <blooop>

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: I neglected to instruct Biggs and Wedge to upgrade my climate shielding. <blip> I will reroute my request to Deputy President Jessie.

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: Engaging ambulation and parting salutations. Farewell, Forename.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Alpha gives a vigorous shake, and draws forth a scrap of paper from under his wing.

dialogue.name: ALPHA
dialogue.text: Kweh!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: It seems he wants you to have it. Perhaps this is his way of thanking you...?

dialogue.name: OMEGA
dialogue.text: (-Omega-)<blip> Swiftly, Alpha! The road is long and we have barely begun our journey!
